intro: Ipomoea gracilis, commonly known as the slender morning glory, is a herbaceous vine native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in disturbed habitats. Ipomoea gracilis is known for its rapid growth and ability to climb using its spiraling stems.
